Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2010 12:08PM Clarity04 wrote: Hello all, I am doing pretty good today.  Sore at the drain sites and in my shoulder blade area. I go to see the surgeon on tomorrow for my first check up and final lab results.  I started Tamoxifen 2 weeks before surgery has anyone else started?  Since that time I have had a rash everywhere. anyone else experienced this??
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 02:30PM Clarity04 wrote:  Hello Group, 1 week post surgery and I am doing fine.  As a reported before I did not have to much discomfort from the surgery in the breast and axillary area just in the shoulder blade area.  I am only taking Advil  (400mg) 2x-3x a day now. I had the best night sleep last  night and feeling rested makes a big difference.  I've been showing my "breast" to select family members and they were surprised at the lack of scars.  The older aunts etc.. remember the horror stories of BMX in the 60's and 70's.  So ...we've come along way baby!  I visit the PS on tomorrow for recheck and to start my TE fills.  Keeping you all lifted to up to our Lord who Heals. Clarity
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2010 09:50AM Clarity04 wrote: Hello all, I haven't posted for awhile.  I'm doing great.  I had BMX surgery  with TE on June 30 and drains removed 3 weeks after.  I plan  to have my last fill on Aug 10 followed by 6 wks of Radiation.  All and all the my recovery was smooth and I am ready to get back to work.
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2010 09:04AM Clarity04 wrote: Hello July Sisters I'm home from the hospital surgery June 30 and home July 2  all went well.  I had a BMX with expanders placed.  I had 5 lymph nodes removed on the right all were clear and a sentinel biopsy on the left with all clear nodes ( praise the Lord!!)  I had a wonderful nursing staff staff and family who took wonderful care of me.  The first day there was quite a bit of pain, but I had access to oral and intravenous drugs that worked well together ask for it. If one type does not work ask for something else.  Hopefully your doctor has left orders for several different drugs, but you must ask.  Don't forget your pillow for the ride home, lozengers for your throat and lip balm for your lips, slip on shoes and button down shirts.    Finding a comfortable sleeping position at home is a challenge, but the recliner seems to be working out.   I will keep you posted
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2010 02:38PM Clarity04 wrote: Photobug,  I had a BMX with TE placed on June 30.  My PS told  me the exact plan as reported by catwood.  The TE will be exchanged in 3-4 months in a procedure in the PS office if he/she has a surgical suite.  The "exchange" is considered outpatient surgery .  He suggested that I could be back to work in 2 weeks after the exchange.  The implants settle for a few months and then the out patient surgery to form a nipple. The profile and projection is picked at a later time.  Try  they forum called "Breast Implants 101" and "Exchange City"  and look for whipettemom she can help you.
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2010 05:13PM Clarity04 wrote: I think I join you sisters.  I am having a bilateral mastectomy on June 30. I also will be having expanders placed followed by radiation.  I had 8 rounds of chemo  (ACT) standard protocol. I just picked out my post -surgery camis and bra today.  I don't know what to expect but I look forward to hearing from all of you.

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2010 07:40PM Clarity04 wrote: Sespebadger, My last day of Chemo was May 11.  My onc and surgical onc wanted me to have my BMX within 30 days of my last treatment.  I was only able to postpone this long because my Plastic Surg.  was booked. So two weeks sounds about right.   I have regained about 60% of my energy level.  I still get tired in the afternoons. Thanks for the encouragement.  I do have fun things planned with my husband.

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2010 09:44AM Clarity04 wrote: Orchidgal  Thanks for the great job of keeping up with the dates etc...  Keep your head up.  It is alright to take some time to take care of yourself.  A hospital stay can be scary, but remember the staff is there to take care of you.  What a blessing to have such good friends and neighbors. Let them do as much as they can for you.  I will keep you in pray also.  I pray the Lord will lift you up and give you strength, comfort, peace and of course healing.
